senses.de: A strong request for something to be done or given
senses.ex: The demand for this product has increased.

Tips.title: Implies Urgency
Tips.description: Using 'demand' suggests you can't wait much longer for a response.
Tips.example: The workers' demand for better conditions was urgent.

Tips.title: Often Assertive
Tips.description: Can be seen as assertive or even aggressive, especially in personal situations.

Tips.title: Confusion with 'Ask'
Tips.description: 'Demand' is much stronger than 'ask'; use it when 'ask' is too mild.
Tips.example: He didn't just ask for silence; he demanded it.

senses.de: To ask for forcefully or urgently
senses.ex: John demanded to speak to the manager.

Tips.title: Conveys Authority
Tips.description: When you 'demand', it often implies a position of power or right.
Tips.example: The officer demanded respect from the recruits.

Tips.title: Immediate Action
Tips.description: Verb form signifies a need or wish for immediate action.
Tips.example: Demanding action, the protesters wouldn't leave.

senses.de: The need for a particular product or service
senses.ex: The demand for electric cars is growing.

Tips.title: Market Relevance
Tips.description: Refers to consumer interest in products or services within a market.
Tips.example: Smartphone demand rises during the holidays.

Tips.title: Impacts Prices
Tips.description: High demand can often increase prices, while low demand might lower them.
Tips.example: Surging demand led to higher prices for flights.

senses.de: To need something in order to be successful or continue existing

Tips.title: Essential Requirement
Tips.description: Emphasizes that something is a necessity, not just a desire.

Tips.title: No Flexibility
Tips.description: Indicates there is no alternative; the need is non-negotiable.
Tips.example: The role demands punctuality at all times.

senses.de: An act of claiming something as due or payment
senses.ex: The bank sent a demand for payment of the loan.

Tips.title: Legal Obligation
Tips.description: Implies a legal right to request payment or action.
Tips.example: The landlord's demand for overdue rent was formal.

Tips.title: Implies Consequences
Tips.description: A legal or formal 'demand' may suggest consequences if not met.
Tips.example: The demand for payment had a strict deadline.

Claim.wordDefinition:
Claim means to state that something is true or belongs to you. For example, if you say that you lost your phone and ask someone to help you find it, you can claim that the phone is yours.

You can use claim when you want to state that something is yours or that something is true, while you can use demand when you want to ask for something strongly or with authority.

Desire.wordDefinition:
Desire refers to a strong feeling of wanting or wishing for something. Unlike demand, desire is not necessarily associated with urgency or necessity.

For example, a person may desire a new phone, but it is not a requirement for their well-being.

Demand implies a stronger and more urgent need, while desire suggests a want or preference, but not necessarily a pressing need.

Exigency.wordDefinition:
Exigency refers to an urgent or pressing need or situation that requires immediate attention or action. It suggests that there is a sense of emergency or crisis.

For example, a doctor might face an exigency when a patient's life is in danger and immediate medical intervention is needed.

Demand is a request or requirement, while exigency is a situation that requires urgent action. Demand is commonly used in everyday conversations, while exigency is more formal and used in specific situations.

Necessity.wordDefinition:
Necessity refers to something that is essential or required for a certain purpose. It implies that something is needed in order to achieve a particular goal or objective.

For example, food, shelter, and clothing are considered necessities for survival.

In simpler terms, demand means wanting something strongly while necessity means needing something essential for a particular purpose.

Order.wordDefinition:
Order means to give a command or instruction to do something. It is applicable to situations when you have an authority to give commands or when you are purchasing something.

For example, you might order food at a restaurant or order your employees to finish a task by a certain deadline.

Request.wordDefinition:
Demand means to forcefully ask for something as a right or with great insistence. It implies a sense of entitlement or an expectation that the request will be fulfilled.

A demand is often more forceful and less flexible than a request.

Request means to politely ask for something, leaving room for the other person to choose whether or not they will fulfill the request.

A request is often less forceful and more respectful than a demand.

Requests are more appropriate in situations where the person is asking for a favor or seeking someone’s help or cooperation.

Requirement.wordDefinition:
Requirement is a condition or criterion that must be met or fulfilled in order to achieve a certain goal or outcome. It refers to something that is necessary or mandatory, usually for legal or regulatory reasons, and that must be satisfied in order to achieve a particular objective.

Demand is a request or desire for something, while requirement is something that must be met in order for something else to be achieved.

Demand is usually applicable in a business or consumer context, while requirements are more commonly found in academic, technical, or legal contexts.

Urgency.wordDefinition:
Urgency refers to the need for something to be done immediately or quickly. For example, if a person is experiencing chest pains, it is urgent that they seek medical attention.

Both words imply a need for action, but demand is typically used in a more formal or business-related context, while urgency is used in situations where there is a time-sensitive need for action, often related to health or safety.

quotes.Text: I've always said that: 'We as black people, if you want respect, you have to give each other respect.' You can't demand respect from white people and the cops if we don't respect each other.
quotes.Title: American Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Charles Barkley

quotes.Text: If all our happiness is bound up entirely in our personal circumstances it is difficult not to demand of life more than it has to give.
quotes.Title: British Philosopher
quotes.Name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.Text: Bayern are a club where success is demanded, and second place isn't particularly appreciated. We have a history and culture to respect.
quotes.Title: German Athlete
quotes.Name: Manuel Neuer

quotes.Text: We all know the demands at this club, but I'm ready for this responsibility to make sure every Madridista is happy.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Sergio Ramos

quotes.Text: If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: John Lennon

quotes.Text: I'm not all that demanding, I don't think. My family might think otherwise.
quotes.Title: Actor
quotes.Name: Josh Hartnett

quotes.Text: I was in constant demand, in my professional life and my personal life.
quotes.Title: Austrian Actress
quotes.Name: Hedy Lamarr

quotes.Text: You demand respect and you'll get it. First of all, you give respect.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mary J. Blige

quotes.Text: First and last, what is demanded of genius is love of truth.
quotes.Title: German Writer
quotes.Name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.Text: You've got to demand the truth from yourself.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Glenn Beck
